step1.sentence: After months of practice, she began to grow in confidence every time she spoke in front of the class.

step2.story: Marcus had always been shy about sharing his ideas at work. But after his manager encouraged him to speak up, he started to grow in confidence with each meeting. By the end of the quarter, he was the first to volunteer for new projects.

step3.story: When Lily first joined the debate club, she could barely finish a sentence without her voice shaking. She practiced every evening, replaying her speeches in the mirror and taking notes on what to improve. Week by week, she began to grow in confidence as she learned to slow down, breathe, and trust her own voice. Her teammates noticed the change—she stood taller and held eye contact instead of staring at the floor. At the regional tournament, Lily delivered her argument without a single stumble, and the applause that followed felt like proof of how far she had come.

meaning.realUsageKo: 경험이 쌓이거나 지속적인 노력을 통해 스스로를 믿는 마음이 서서히 강해지는 과정을 표현할 때 사용한다. 주로 학습, 업무, 사회적 상황에서의 성장을 묘사하는 맥락에서 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'grow'는 고대 영어 'growan'(자라다)에서 유래했으며, 'confidence'는 라틴어 'confidentia'(신뢰, 확신)에서 왔다. 두 단어가 결합해 자신감이 식물처럼 서서히 자라는 이미지를 전달한다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단번에 자신감을 얻는 것이 아니라 점진적이고 지속적인 성장을 강조하는 표현이다. 긍정적이고 희망적인 뉘앙스를 지니며, 노력과 경험의 축적을 함의한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He grew in confidence after completing his first solo presentation.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 첫 단독 발표를 마친 후 자신감이 커졌다.
